title: Fruits in summer spoil faster
text: Fruits like berries and peaches spoil faster in warm weather. Refrigerate berries, eat in 2–3 days, or freeze for smoothies.

title: Creative leftover ideas
text: Turn cooked vegetables into a frittata, roast bones into broth, stale bread into croutons or breadcrumbs, and use wilting greens in soups.

title: Budget meal planning
text: Plan 2–3 base ingredients (rice, beans, seasonal veg). Buy in bulk, freeze single portions, and reuse ingredients across meals.

title: Local food sharing
text: Use local platforms, community fridges, or neighbor groups. Package safely, note expiry, and offer during daytime pickups.

title: Environmental impacts
text: Food waste contributes to greenhouse gas emissions. Reducing waste saves money and carbon; prioritize perishable items to reduce landfill methane.
